content: It appears that rust-lang/rust has the rustc-dev-guide as a submodule at src/doc/rustc-dev-guide. However, the submodule hasn't been updated since April 2020. Should we remove the submodule or update it?
I didnâ€™t even know it was available in the doc folder
AFAIK that this was the directory where the dev guide once lived. It was moved into a separate repo some time ago and kept as a submodule.

I'm in favor of removing it, and leaving a src/doc/readme.md with a link to the dev guide repo.
Submodules can be a pain to deal with anyway, and apparently nobody needed the dev guide _inside_ the main repo for so long.

That PR has been closed, seems we decided to update the submodule for now. It's unclear to me that we just want to include it in rust-docs, i.e. we don't check the toolstate, or we also want to check it. So, do y'all still want to leave the instructions on README ( https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide#how-to-fix-toolstate-failures )?
I think we should implement https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/81848#issuecomment-787588985 and then remove the submodule and delete the instructions.
